summary: This document is an email chain from March 2021 regarding a proposal from CACI International Inc. for scanning services related to the USAO SDNY case US v. Maxwell (Epstein). The emails discuss moving forward with the CACI proposal as a contingency plan if 'Florida' arrangements fall through, indicating logistical planning for evidence handling in the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution.

events.title: CACI Proposal Submission for Case Scanning
events.description: CACI International Inc. submits a proposal in response to a Request for Proposal (RFP) for scanning services related to the US v. Maxwell (Epstein) case for the USAO SDNY.

events.title: Approval of Contingency Scanning Plan
events.description: Email chain shows approval to proceed with the CACI scanning proposal as a contingency plan in case arrangements with 'Florida' break down.

locations: 7725 West Reno Ave., Oklahoma City, OK 73127
keyFacts: A proposal from defense contractor CACI International Inc. was submitted for scanning services related to the US v. Maxwell (Epstein) case for the Southern District of New York USAO.

The email chain indicates the scanning services were a contingency plan, to be used if arrangements with 'Florida' (likely referring to evidence or proceedings related to Epstein's Florida case) fell through.
The correspondence highlights logistical and evidence-handling preparations undertaken by the prosecution team in the Ghislaine Maxwell case in March 2021.
The document is an internal email chain forwarding a business proposal, showing the administrative and contractual steps behind the scenes of the high-profile case.
